expand.Title: Implementing 'static' control flow in C++14
expand.Text: There has always been great interest in imperative compile-time control flow: as an example, consider all the existing 'static_if' proposals and the recently accepted 'constexpr_if' construct for C++17.   What if you were told that it is actually possible to implement imperative control flow in C++14?   In this tutorial, the implementation and design of a compile-time 'static_if' branching construct and of a compile-time 'static_for' iteration construct will be shown and analyzed. These constructs will then be compared to traditional solutions and upcoming C++17 features, examining advantages and drawbacks.
